}}  'Yorkshire and the Humber' is one of nine official
regions of England at the first level of NUTS for statistical purposes. When the
Government Office Regions were created in 1994 it was called Yorkshire &
Humberside with the counties of North Yorkshire, South Yorkshire, West Yorkshire
and Humberside. However Humberside was abolished hence the Region name Yorkshire
and the Humber. The population in 2011 was 5,284,000. The British Government has announced its intention to
abolish Government Offices (for the Regions) no later than 31 March 2011.
categories: NUTS 1 statistical regions of the European Union
